chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Lee Merrill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc:
180 days jail with credit for 90 days, time served, consecutive to count 1, case # 15CF220; Revocation of DL: 27 months plus 180 days,  DOT to credit any administrative suspension and add any period of incarceration to revocation sentence;  IID installed for 27 months on any vehicle owned or operated effective 9/22/2016;   OWI assessment within 72 hours and AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations;   Attend Victim Impact Panel; Obtain a driver assessment and maintain compliance with driver safety plan; Costs/forfeiture of $ 1,744.00   Pay obligation within 30 days of release or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 30 days of release and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.  
Counts 3 and 4, dismissed and read-in.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon Lee Merrill in court with attorney Heidi J. Mangelsen.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter resolved.   DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts
DEF pleads guilty to Counts 1 & 2. Court accepts plea, finds DEF guilty. 
Parties argue sentence. Joint recommendation. DEF addresses court.
Court imposes in Count 1: 9 months jail consecutive to Barron Cty case # 7CF234, Huber priviledges, costs of $  468.00. Pay or set up payplan within 30 days of release.  Count 2: 180 days jail with credit for 90 days, time served, consecutive to count 1, case # 15CF220; Revocation of DL: 27 months plus 180 days,  DOT to credit any administrative suspension and add any period of incarceration to revocation sentence;  IID installed for 27 months on any vehicle owned or operated effective 9/22/2016;   OWI assessment within 72 hours and AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations;   Attend Victim Impact Panel; Obtain a driver assessment and maintain compliance with driver safety plan; Costs/forfeiture of $ 1,744.00   Pay obligation within 30 days of release or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 30 days of release and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.  
Counts 3 and 4, dismissed and read-in.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 9, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Heidi J. Mangelsen in court, defendant Brandon Lee Merrill not in court, in custody at Stanley Correctional Facility.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Set for PLEAS. State to prepare order for writ.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 16, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on May 31, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Brandon Lee Merrill in court, in custody with attorney Heidi J. Mangelsen.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
With counsel, DEF pleads NG to Cnt # 1.
ADA Marcoux requests bond to continue.
Court so orders. 
  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Brandon Lee Merrill in court, in custody with attorney Heidi J. Mangelsen.  Bruce Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Patrol Deputy Malcolm Haag called. Witness sworn/testifies.
DA Poquette: direct
Atty Mangelsen: no questions. Witness excused. No other witnesses.
No argument. Requests bind over.
Court: PC found. DEF bound over.
  Arraignment scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Brandon Lee Merrill in court with attorney Heidi J. Mangelsen.  Defendant Brandon Lee Merrill in custody appeared by video.  Aaron Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Counsel enters a NG Plea on counts 2 & 3, accepted by court.    Requests preliminary hearing within time limits.   Bond Continues.    15TR1145 and 15TR1146 track with Case 15CF220  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Absolute sobriety.  Not to consume/possess any alcoholic beverages.  Not to operate a motor vehicle w/o a valid permit
Absolute sobriety.  Not to consume/possess any alchollic beverages.  Not to operate a motor vehicle w/o a valid permit.
